definition: to (try to) find the time to
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: I really encourage you to take time to make these garnishes.
sentences.chinese: 我真的推荐你抽时间制作这些装饰物。

sentences.english: I appreciate that you working hard, but pls make time for me .
sentences.chinese: 你要先努力工作，然后尽量抽时间陪我。

sentences.english: "It's so nice that the world's biggest movie stars make time for their kids," the source added.
sentences.chinese: 这样的大明星愿意抽时间出来陪孩子们真是太好了。

sentences.english: At Christmas he found time to have a cup or two of holiday cheer and don his holly-shaped bow tie.
sentences.chinese: 到圣诞节，他会抽时间喝几杯酒，打好蝶形领结。

sentences.english: Try to find as much time as possible to do what you love.
sentences.chinese: 尽可能多地抽时间去做你喜爱的事情。

sentences.english: Father is always very busy, seldom take out time to come out to be like to sit down to discuss heart now.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸一向很忙，难得抽时间出来像现在坐下来谈谈心。

sentences.english: Thank you all for making time for this today. We appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 非常感谢诸位抽时间参加今天的访谈。

sentences.english: I’ll find time again when the current rush is over.
sentences.chinese: 忙完这段时间后我会再抽时间写博客的。

sentences.english: Please try and find time to read the document before the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 开会前请抽时间把文件看一下。

sentences.english: You have my word, I’ll spend some time with you on the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证，周末抽时间来陪你。

sentences.english: We must get to together again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须抽时间再聚一聚。

sentences.english: She is very busy, but she always finds time to help other people.
sentences.chinese: 她很忙，可是她总会抽时间去帮助别人。

sentences.english: You should try and find time to sport with your little baby.
sentences.chinese: 你应该抽时间和你的小宝宝玩耍。

definition: to find the time to do sth
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
another day/some other time/to find another day (for appointment etc)/to take a rain check
to visit/to pay a call to
to take up time/to spend time
to roam around/to have a stroll
